question: Maximum permissible radiation dose in pregnancy is:
exp: Ans. is 'a' i.e. 0.5 radRef. Diagnostic radiology and Imaging by K. Subbarao, Jaypee publication, Christensen's physics of diagnostic radiologyMaximum permissible radiation doseIs that dose which if received each year for a 50 year working lifetime would not be expected to produce any harmful effect?The maximum permissible dose for a pregnant woman is 0.5 rads in gestation periodAlso knowThe gestation period when the fetus is most sensitive to the effect of radiation -8-15 weeks of gestationThe'10 day rule'This rule advices that any x-ray examination involving the abdomen of a women of child -bearing age should be carried out within 10 days of the onset of menstruation.
